author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A security incident at Vancouver International Airport (YVR) led to delays and flights being diverted earlier Tuesday afternoon. According to a press release from the airport, around 1:30 p.m. Pacific Standard Time a “security incident” occurred with a private plane in the airspace close to YVR. This led to the temporarily grounding of all arriving […]
title: ‘Security Incident’ Disrupts Vancouver Flights: Police

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Dangerous wireless power banks are being recalled in increasing numbers, but at least 34,000 remain in use, the ACCC warns.
title: Defective Chargers Posing Risk to 34,000 Consumers

author: Cindy Li
description: 'My government's approach to our relationship with China is patient, is calibrated, and is deliberate,' said Anthony Albanese.
title: Trade Tops Agenda as Albanese Meets Xi: Darwin Port, US Not Mentioned

author: Chandra Philip
description: Two Ontario teachers are challenging their dismissal with a human rights complaint against the school board, alleging they were fired for not supporting LGBT events. Matt and Nicole Alexander were long-term employees of the Renfrew County District School Board (RCDSB) when they were suspended, and later fired, in 2023, according to the Justice Centre for […]
title: 2 Ontario Teachers Allege They Were Fired for Not Supporting LGBT Celebrations, Launch Legal Challenge

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Amphibious Landing Rehearsal, Grand Canyon Fire, End of San Fermin

author: Olivia Gomm
description: While levels of wildfire preparation vary across Canada, Canadians living in the West are more likely to prepare for the risk of wildfire season than those in the rest of the country, a new survey indicates. Canadians were asked what steps they had taken in their households to address concerns about wildfires over the past […]
title: Wildfire Preparation Varies Among Canadians Across the Country: Survey

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative MPs on a federal health committee are calling for a special summer meeting within five days to review the Vaccine Injury Support Program (VISP) after a report raised concern about its efficiency. A July 14 letter addressed to Liberal MP Hedy Fry, who serves as the chair of the House of Commons health committee, […]
title: Conservatives Call for Investigation Into COVID-19 Vaccine Injury Support Program

author: Epoch Video
description: The Defense Forum Foundation and the North Korea Freedom Coalition, two Washington-based think tanks, hold a congressional defense and foreign policy lunch forum on North Korea’s future at 12:30 p.m. ET on July 16.
title: Congressional Defense and Foreign Policy Lunch Forum on North Korea’s Future

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis The federal government has made a very public foreign policy shift to deepen ties with Europe amid uncertainty in the Canada-U.S. relationship, but changes are also afoot regarding how Ottawa deals with Asia. Under pressure to find new markets, all eyes are on how Canada will manage the India and U.S. adversary China […]
title: Canada’s Foreign Policy Shift Extends to Asia—What’s the Plan So Far?

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The RCMP is investigating after a woman was found suffering from serious burns near a casino in Langley, B.C., on July 12. “Upon arrival, front-line officers located a 37-year-old woman suffering from severe burns. She was immediately transported to a local area hospital for urgent medical treatment,” Langley RCMP said in a July 14 statement. […]
title: RCMP Investigating After Woman Found Badly Burned in Langley, BC

author: John Robson
description: Commentary Gosh. That was fast. Problem solved. A spokesperson for the finance minister says his call for across-the-board cuts based on finding efficiencies is “a long-term transformation of government.” And here some of us thought it meant a long-term slog through inertia and perverse incentives past the bones of umpteen failed efforts to trim fat […]
title: John Robson: Cutting Government Spending Is So Far Just an Aspiration

author: Bill Pan
description: The White House has dismissed a report that Trump had 'encouraged' Ukraine to hit the Russian capital and St. Petersburg.
title: Trump ‘Not Looking’ to Give Ukraine Missiles Capable of Striking Moscow

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with researcher and writer Ben Pile to talk about the lack of debate on climate, the media’s stifling of views that question prevailing narratives, the vanishing green jobs, and how our weather reports have been weaponized.
title: Green Lies, Climate Disinformation, and the Censorship Complex: Ben Pile

author: Zachary Stieber
description: Officials said more children should receive vaccines.
title: 14 Million Children Received No Vaccines in 2024: United Nations

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: An RCMP officer is under criminal investigation and subject to an ethics probe after being accused of making threatening comments online during last month’s G7 conference in Kananaskis, Alta. The RCMP confirmed the allegations to the Epoch Times but added that further details including the officer’s identity and employment status won’t be provided at this […]
title: RCMP Officer Faces Criminal Probe After Allegedly Posting Threats Online During G7

author: The Canadian Press
description: Special air-quality statements caused by wildfire smoke remain in effect for many areas of the country, and in some places, people are also handling stifling heat and humidity as well as the haze. Much of Central Canada, Manitoba and Saskatchewan were placed under special air quality statements or warnings on Monday due to smoke from […]
title: Much of Canada Smoky, Other Parts Get Heat, and Some Areas Seeing Both

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The B.C. city of Nanaimo is proposing to build a fence around its city hall parking lot to protect staff from violence and disorder associated with “congregations” of people who frequent a supervised drug consumption site located next to the city’s parking lot. City staff have proposed a 1.83-metre-high fence, which will cost an estimated […]
title: Nanaimo Considering Fence Around City Hall to Protect Staff From Drug Consumption Site Disorder

author: Guy Birchall
description: A new deal will allow more food and humanitarian aid into the Gaza strip.
title: EU Diplomats Discuss Gaza Aid Deal

author: Michael Wing
description: It appears in summer during fishing season. It’s name is steeped in Native American folklore. The full moon in August was called the Sturgeon Moon after the overabundance of the bottom-dwelling fish that for centuries helped sustain tribes around the Great Lakes region. This year’s full Sturgeon Moon falls on Aug. 9 at precisely 3:55 […]
title: Full ‘Sturgeon’ Moon Will Join a Stunning Planetary Alignment Next Month—What to Know

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney suggested that a trade deal with the United States may ultimately still include tariffs on Canada, as the two countries attempt to work out a deal before the August 1 deadline. Speaking to reporters ahead of a cabinet meeting in Ottawa on July 15, Carney told reporters that there is “not […]
title: Carney Says Some Tariffs on Canada May Remain in Deal With US

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Nearly one-third of Canadians are now classified as obese, a condition that saw a sharp increase during the COVID-19 pandemic, a new study suggests. The rate of obesity in Canada rose more rapidly in the four years following the onset of the pandemic than in the previous 11 years, particularly among younger adults, according to […]
title: Canadian Obesity Levels Soared During COVID-19 Pandemic: Study

description: Trump had said earlier this week he would introduce 'secondary tariffs' on goods from third countries that trade with Russia.

description: Fauja Singh became the oldest man to run a full marathon in 2011 at the age of 100 in Toronto.

description: The British government has disclosed the scale and cost of a covert Afghan resettlement operation triggered by a sensitive data breach.

description: Ottawa is seeking input from Canadians on defence spending and how to best strengthen the economy during an ongoing trade war, as it prepares to announce a federal budget this fall. author: The Canadian Press
description: The annual pace of inflation accelerated to 1.9 percent in June as consumers were paying more at car dealerships, Statistics Canada said Tuesday. The June price hike is up from 1.7 percent in May and was largely in line with economists’ expectations. StatCan said gasoline prices were nearly unchanged in June as higher crude oil […]
title: Inflation Rises to 1.9% in June as Vehicle Price Hikes Accelerate

author: The Canadian Press
description: Day parole has been revoked for the woman who drowned Victoria teenager Reena Virk 28 years ago. A Parole Board of Canada decision released Monday says Kerry Sim, known as Kelly Ellard when she was convicted, breached her conditions to abstain from drugs. The decision says Sim adamantly rejected the test result for methamphetamine, and […]
title: Drug Use Sees Parole Revoked for Kerry Sim, Who Killed BC Teen Reena Virk in 1997

description: The judge said emissions policy should be decided by parliament, not the courts.
